metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8899 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Dnsmasq before 2.76 allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a reply with an empty DNS address that has an (1) A or (2) AAAA record defined locally.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8899` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
dnsmasq-base - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
dnsmasq-utils - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
